revisions.rev:
{{Geobox|Range | name=Conrad Mountains | native_name=Conradfjella | image=Conrad Mountains North.jpg | image_caption=View looking to the west over [[Glopeken glacier]], in the northern part of the Conrad Mountains. | image_flag= | map=Antarctica,_Norway_territorial_claim.svg | map_caption=Map depicting the territorial extent of Queen Maud Land | region=[[Queen Maud Land]], [[East Antarctica]] | region_type = | country=Antarctica | country_type=Continent | country_flag=true | parent=[[East Antarctica Ranges]] | border= | geology= | period= | orogeny= | highest=[[Sandeggtind Peak]] | highest_elevation_imperial=10023 | highest_lat_d=71|highest_lat_m=50|highest_lat_s=00|highest_lat_NS=S | highest_long_d=09|highest_long_m=40|highest_long_s=00|highest_long_EW=E }} The '''Conrad Mountains''' ({{lang-no|'''Conradfjella'''}}) are a narrow chain of mountains, {{convert|19|mi}} long, located between the [[Gagarin Mountains]] and [[Mount Dallmann]] in [[Queen Maud Land]], [[Antarctica]]. The Conrad Mountains are a [[mountain range|subrange]] of the [[Orvin Mountains]]. With its [[Summit (topography)|summit]] at {{convert|3055|m|0}}, the massive [[Sandeggtind Peak]] forms the highest point in the Conrad Mountains.
==Discovery and naming== {{Location map|Antarctica|lat_deg=71|lat_min=50|lat_dir=S|lon_deg=09|lon_min=40|lon_dir=E|float=left|mark=Fire.svg|marksize=12|AlternativeMap=Antarctica relief location map.jpg|label=Conrad Mountains|position=top|caption=Map depicting the location of the Conrad Mountains in [[Queen Maud Land]], [[Antarctica]]}}
The Conrad Mountains were discovered by the [[Third German Antarctic Expedition]] (1938â1939), led by Captain [[Alfred Ritscher]], and named for Rear Admiral Heinrich Friedrich (Fritz) Conrad (18 April 1883 â 1 January 1944), director of the meteorological division of the former Marineleitung (German Admiralty). They were surveyed by the [[Sixth Norwegian Antarctic Expedition]], 1956-1960.<ref>{{cite gnis | type = antarid | id = 3054 | name = Conrad Mountains | accessdate = 21 November 2011}}</ref>
